name: Raging Bitch
description: The American IPA hoppiness or Belgian funk of Raging Bitch can be brought out with food. Flavor notes: Sweet malt body contrasted with pine and grapefruit hop flavors and exotic fruit yeast notes. Pairs with: Wasabi, ginger, jerk, Cajun, or cayenne; tangy cheese with fruit; dark chocolate

name: Snake Dog
description: IPAs emphasize the heat in spicy foods and smooth out creamy, fatty foods. Flavor notes: Big citrus (notably grapefruit) hop aroma and flavor with caramel malt notes Pairs with: Mexican, Thai, curry, wasabi, buttery and spicy cheeses, exotic fruits

name: Bloodline
description: Bloodline begins with huge grapefruit on the nose. Then, a delicate balance of citrus sweetness and bitterness. Try it with grilled light proteins, salads with fruity vinaigrettes, and fresh salsa.

name: Fat Tire
description: Named in honor of our co-founder's bike trip through Europe, Fat Tire Amber Ale marks a turning point in the young electrical engineer's home brewing. Fat Tire won fans with its sense of balance: toasty, biscuit-like malt flavors coasting in equilibrium with hoppy freshness. Fat Tire: Pairs well with people

name: Trippel
description: his golden beer opens with a bold blast of spicy Noble hops, courtesy of Saaz and Hallertau Mittlefruh, and gives way to the fruity aromas offered by our traditional Belgian yeast. Brewed with Pilsner and Munich malts, Trippel is classically smooth and complex, and sings with a high-note of sweet citrus before a pleasantly dry finish delivers a warm, strong boozy bite. Give Trippel a sip to get you smiling.

name: 60 Minute IPA
description: 60 Minute is brewed with a slew of great Northwest hops. A powerful but balanced East Coast IPA with a lot of citrusy hop character, it's the session beer for hardcore enthusiasts!

name: Harpoon IPA
description: Harpoon IPA finds harmony in the combination of hops, malt, and yeast so that no single ingredient dominates the drinking experience. Floral and citrus hop notes combine with a sturdy malt backbone to impart a clean, fresh finish. Harpoon IPA is a crisp, balanced interpretation of this classic style.
A sort of dry, crisp, refreshing, not quite pale ale, #9 is really impossible to describe because thereâ€™s never been anything else quite like it.
